ccsd_lpno package¶

This package contains all submodules necessary to run calculations.

Submodules¶

ccsd_lpno.cc_lambda module¶

HelperLambda class definition and function definitions

For iteratively solving for lambda lagrangian multipliers after completing a CCSD calculation and building Hbar matrix elements

class ccsd_lpno.cc_lambda.HelperLambda(hcc, hbar)¶

Bases: object

Class for setting up and running a left hand CCSD amplitude calculation.

Spin-adapted equations using an RHF wavefunction. Need to instantiate the object and then call the iterate() function

Parameters

  • hcc (class 'ccsd_lpno.HelperCCEnergy') – HelperCCEnergy object returned from CCSD calculation

  • hbar (class 'ccsd_lpno.HelperHbar') – HelperHbar object instantiated using cc_hbar

iterate(local=None, e_conv=1e-08, r_conv=1e-07, maxiter=40, max_diis=8, start_diis=0)¶

Do Lambda iterations with DIIS and local options

Parameters

  • local (class 'ccsd_lpno.HelperLocal') – Object containing the increment function for local correlation calculations

  • e_conv (double) – Convergence threshold for energy

  • r_conv (double) – Convergence threshold for T-amplitude RMSDs

  • maxiter (integer) – Maximum no. of iterations

  • max_diis (integer) – Maximum no. of error vectors stored for DIIS

  • start_diis (integer) – Which iteration to start storing error vectors for DIIS

Returns

Converged CCSD energy

Return type

double

make_Gvv()¶

Update L1 and L2 amplitudes

  • l_ijab (numpy array) – Previous iteration’s L2 amplitudes

  • local (class 'ccsd_lpno.HelperLocal') – Object containing the increment function for local correlation calculations

ccsd_lpno.cc_pert module¶

HelperPert class definition and function definitions For iteratively solving for first order T amplitudes and first order lagrangian multipliers, then solving for the linear response function for two given perturbations, after completing a CCSD calculation and building Hbar matrix elements, lambdas

ccsd_lpno.helper_cc module¶

HelperCCEnergy class definition and function definitions For RHF CCSD calculations Includes localization via a HelperLocal class

class ccsd_lpno.helper_cc.HelperCCEnergy(rhf_wfn, local=None, pert=False, pno_cut=0, e_cut=1e-08)¶

Bases: object

Class for setting up and running a CCSD correlation energy calculation.

Spin-adapted equations using an RHF wavefunction. Need to instantiate the object and then call the do_cc() function

Parameters

  • rhf_wfn (class 'psi4.core.RHF') – Psi4 wavefunction returned from RHF calculation

  • local (class 'ccsd_lpno.HelperLocal') – Object containing functions for local correlation calculations

  • pert (bool) – Flag to use perturbed density (density is currently hardcoded)

  • pno_cut (double) – Occupation number cutoff for truncating PNO space

  • e_cut (double) – Weak pair cutoff for truncation of occupied pairs

corr_energy(t_ia, t_ijab)¶

Compute CCSD correlation energy

Parameters

  • t_ia (numpy array) – T1 used for corr energy calculation

  • t_ijab (numpy array) – T2 used for corr energy calculation

Returns

correlation energy

Return type

double

do_CC(local=None, e_conv=1e-08, r_conv=1e-07, maxiter=40, max_diis=8, start_diis=0)¶
make_Fae(taut, t_ia, t_ijab)¶

make_Zmbij(tau)¶
make_tau(t_ia, t_ijab)¶
make_taut(t_ia, t_ijab)¶
update_ts(tau, tau_t, t_ia, t_ijab, local=None)¶

Update T1 and T2 amplitudes

Parameters

  • tau (numpy array) – T + 1/2 (T1^2)

  • tau_t (numpy array) – tau^+

  • t_ia (numpy array) – old T1 amplitude to be used in the residual equations

  • t_ijab (numpy array) – old T2 amplitude to be used in the residual equations

  • local (class 'ccsd_lpno.HelperLocal') – Object containing the increment function for local correlation calculations

Returns

Updated T1 and T2 amplitudes

Return type

numpy arrays

ccsd_lpno.linresp module¶

Computing the CCSD-LR dipole polarizability using an RHF reference

References used:

  • http://github.com/CrawfordGroup/ProgrammingProjects

  • Stanton:1991:4334

  • https://github.com/psi4/psi4numpy

ccsd_lpno.linresp.do_linresp(wfn, omega_nm, mol, method='polar', gauge='length', localize=False, pert=False, pno_cut=0)¶
